definition:
The Bargmann-Fock space (or simply Fock space) is the Hilbert space of
entire functions, $\mathcal{F}^2(\mathbb{C})$ s.t.
$$\int_\mathbb{C}|F(z)|^2 e^{- \pi |z|^2}dx dy<\infty$$ with associated
inner product $$\int_\mathbb{C}F(z)\overline{G(z)}e^{- \pi |z|^2}dx dy$$

where $z=x+i y$
